column2: The witness must be questioned and his description according to his recollection of
the perpetrator extracted and recorded before he is invited to examine the parade
In view of the provisions in Article 13(3) of the Constitution recognizing the right of an

accused  person 
to  a 
fair 
trial  by  a  competent  court,  evidence  of 
improper
identification must be excluded if the court is of the view that its admission would
have an adverse effect on the fairness of the proceedings.
